channel.title: Getting The F--k Online!
channel.description: I've had everything done with my server (to my knowledge) except getting it the F--k online! I don't understand how to get an I.P. and Port and what not together, so others can enter it and log on, also, I need to know how to make a rule under advanced settings or some s--t is what the tutorial said. If you can help me figure out the I.P. and the Port and whatnot, and making the rule in my router, or allowance in the firewall or whatever I need to get my server online, please help. I will give you an Admin position on my server if you can help me, my msn is imthat_onedude@hotmail.com, or e-mail me at z_noel@sbcglobal.net, please...please help me someone I've been frustrated with this for 2-3 weeks.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 18, 2007, 06:21:21 PM[/size][hr]Anyone?...Please?... :([br][size=1]Posted on: January 18, 2007, 06:23:55 PM[/size][hr]O.M.G....Please

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @Le_Hawtz Le Hawtz
item.description:
@Le_Hawtz wrote:

Hamachi seems to be the easiest way, but what i don’t get is the password thing, I’ve seen people advertise Hamachi servers before, Where would they enter the password in order to get into it, and is there an option where i can set no password required? Thanks[br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 02:08:53 PM[/size][hr]ok i got it up got my ip and what not, it seems easy i just need to know the password thing, and to have my server be online once you explain the pass thing to me, i will just have to have the runserver up and hamachi turned on? and people can log on?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 02:14:10 PM[/size][hr]ok i got it up, i can log on without putting in 0.0.0.0 as the ip when i runserver, i put in the ip hamachi gives me, turn hamachi on and run server and i can log on, does that mean others can?

[br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 02:46:47 PM[/size][hr]i figured it out tysm man, if my server ip is 5.117.237.11 username is lehawtzpkscape and password is 123 if u wanna come on my server, ill make u admin (exe626)

Read full topic

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Dude, try this.
Go to hamachi.cc
download it… and run what it ask
When you sign into it you will see this number,
Its at the top of the little screen…
It might look like 0.00.000.00
but not wit to many zeros o.-
Thats your ip, when you run your server, type that in to log in…
Tell people this ip+usr/pass for your hamachi network you created…
COMPLETE!

Read full topic

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @LuseN LuseN
item.description:
@LuseN wrote:

[quote=“Wolfen Sty, post:6, topic:49066”]Go to this link:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Look at chapter 1, and try to do as much as you possibly can. Even look through the rest of the Tutorial for more clarification.

Hints

  • When it asks you to find the IP of your COMPUTER, do this:

  1. Click the “Start” button on the bottom left side of your screen.

  2. Click on “Run.”

  3. In the space where you can type in, type in: CMD

  4. Now simply type in: ip config and press enter.

  5. Where it says “Default Gateway,” look at the IP after it. That’s the one.

  • To Access Your Router -

  1. Go open up your web browser( Like, Internet Explorer, Firefox…) and type that IP into the address bar.

  2. Press enter. A thing will pop-up asking for a Username and Password. For Username type in Admin, and for password type in password.

If you need more help, just post here.[/quote]

“Admin” as username and “password”? Doesn’t work for me… Oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @Wolfen_Sty Wolfen Sty
item.description:
@Wolfen_Sty wrote:

Go to this link:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Look at chapter 1, and try to do as much as you possibly can. Even look through the rest of the Tutorial for more clarification.

Hints

  • When it asks you to find the IP of your COMPUTER, do this:

  1. Click the “Start” button on the bottom left side of your screen.

  2. Click on “Run.”

  3. In the space where you can type in, type in: CMD

  4. Now simply type in: ip config and press enter.

  5. Where it says “Default Gateway,” look at the IP after it. That’s the one.

  • To Access Your Router -

  1. Go open up your web browser( Like, Internet Explorer, Firefox…) and type that IP into the address bar.

  2. Press enter. A thing will pop-up asking for a Username and Password. For Username type in Admin, and for password type in password.

If you need more help, just post here.

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @Le_Hawtz Le Hawtz
item.description:
@Le_Hawtz wrote:

ok i had no idea what you just said as far as #1 goes, can you like tell me, what to open up, what to click, where it is, and what not, i’m good at directions but i need to be explained in detail…and if you have a msn add me (imthat_onedude@hotmail.com) it’s alot quicker then the forums[br][size=1]Posted on: January 18, 2007, 06:36:26 PM[/size][hr]and how would i figure out my ip?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 18, 2007, 06:37:19 PM[/size][hr]help me…someone…

Read full topic

item.title: Getting The F--k Online!
item.dc:creator: @Hikaru Hikaru
item.description:
@Hikaru wrote:

1.) Go to command prompt and type in ‘ipconfig’. The Default Gateway is your router IP. Go to that link (“http://(yourip)”) and enter your username and password. (usually admin, password).

2.) I use Hamachi, but No-IP is much better and I plan to switch to it.

Read full topic

2.) Do you want to do No-IP or Hamachi?
